Using the figure, which two groups will form a strong ionic bond? <image 1>

A. Group 1 and Group 17
B. Group 1 and Group 14
C. Group 14 and Group 18
D. Group 1 and Group 18

A strong ionic bond forms between a metal (Group 1) and a nonmetal (Group 17). The figure shows that Group 1 elements have one valence electron, and Group 17 elements have seven valence electrons. When these elements combine, the metal will lose its electron to the nonmetal, resulting in a strong ionic bond. Therefore, the correct answer is A.
